alert.note: Alert for Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 22 at 3:48PM CDT until March 22 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Marion County in northwestern Alabama... * Until 430 PM CDT. * At 348 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Detroit, or 8 miles northwest of Sulligent, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Weston, Byrd, Bexar, Pigeye, Marion County Public Lake, Rankin Fite Airport, Pikeville and Shottsville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
